answers.permissibleValue:
Lactose free formula (including soy or hydrolyzed)
Description: Whether the infant is on a soy or hydrolyzed formula. Only these two types of formulas do not contain lactose, which can affect galactosemia screening results because the infant does not have a sufficient lactose load. This answer is important for result interpretation. Absence of lactose can give a false negative result.
answers.valueMeaningName:
Lactose free formula (including soy or hydrolyzed)
Description: Whether the infant is on a soy or hydrolyzed formula. Only these two types of formulas do not contain lactose, which can affect galactosemia screening results because the infant does not have a sufficient lactose load. This answer is important for result interpretation. Absence of lactose can give a false negative result.

answers.permissibleValue:
None
Description: a way to indicate that the infant has had no feeds of any kind (by mouth, by IV, etc.)
answers.valueMeaningName:
None
Description: a way to indicate that the infant has had no feeds of any kind (by mouth, by IV, etc.)

answers.permissibleValue:
Physical findings of syndromes that include hearing loss
Description: Physical findings, such as white forelock, that are associated with a syndrome known to include a sensorineural or permanent conductive hearing loss.
answers.valueMeaningName:
Physical findings of syndromes that include hearing loss
Description: Physical findings, such as white forelock, that are associated with a syndrome known to include a sensorineural or permanent conductive hearing loss.

answers.permissibleValue:
Syndromes associated with hearing loss
Description: Syndromes associated with hearing loss or progressive or late-onset hearing loss, such as neurofibromatosis, osteopetrosis, and Usher syndrome; other frequently identified syndromes include Waardenburg, Alport, Pendred, and Jervell and Lange-Nielson.
answers.valueMeaningName:
Syndromes associated with hearing loss
Description: Syndromes associated with hearing loss or progressive or late-onset hearing loss, such as neurofibromatosis, osteopetrosis, and Usher syndrome; other frequently identified syndromes include Waardenburg, Alport, Pendred, and Jervell and Lange-Nielson.

answers.permissibleValue:
Neurodegenerative disorders
Description: Neurodegenerative disorders, such as Hunter syndrome, or sensory motor neuropathies, such as Friedreich ataxia and Charcot-Marie-Tooth syndrome.
answers.valueMeaningName:
Neurodegenerative disorders
Description: Neurodegenerative disorders, such as Hunter syndrome, or sensory motor neuropathies, such as Friedreich ataxia and Charcot-Marie-Tooth syndrome.
